template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing an end-to-end content campaign task in the {industry} space that involves research, multi-format content creation, consistency across channels, and measurable goals; output only the prompt text under 45 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing an end-to-end content campaign task in the manufacturing space that involves research, multi-format content creation, consistency across channels, and measurable goals; output only the prompt text under 45 words.

message.content: Research, plan, and execute a unified campaign producing blog posts, case studies, and videos to generate qualified leads for our new manufacturing line.
message.reasoning_content:
Okay, the user wants me to generate a prompt for a content campaign in manufacturing. Let me break down the requirements. They specified it needs to be a single sentence in plain English, under 45 words, and include research, multi-format content creation, consistency across channels, and measurable goals.

First, I need to make sure all those elements are covered. Research is essential, so starting with that makes sense. Then multi-format content—maybe mention specific types like blog posts and videos. Consistency across channels should be implied by mentioning a unified campaign. Measurable goals could be tied to lead generation or engagement.

Let me check the word count. "Research, plan, and execute a unified campaign" covers research and consistency. "Producing blog posts, case studies, and videos" hits multi-format. "To generate qualified leads" adds the measurable goal. That’s 24 words—under the limit. It flows as one sentence and stays in plain English. Did I miss anything? The manufacturing space is addressed by context, so maybe it’s implied. Should I specify it’s for manufacturing? The user said "in the manufacturing space," so the prompt already assumes that context. Yeah, this should work.
